title: 34.4 NP-Completeness Proofs
content:
Section 34.4

NP-Completeness Proofs

Summary

How to prove a problem is NP-complete.

Key Points

  • Step 1: Show problem is in NP (verify solution in poly time)
  • Step 2: Show problem is NP-hard (reduce from known NP-complete)
  • Key: transform instances in polynomial time
  • Preserve YES/NO answers
  • Common source problems: 3-SAT, CLIQUE, VERTEX-COVER

Example

Prove VERTEX-COVER NP-complete: reduce from CLIQUE. G has k-clique iff complement has (n-k)-vertex-cover.

Why It Matters

Toolkit for proving computational difficulty of new problems.
